value.title: Facebook Pushes Back Against Report That Claims Its AI Sucks at Detecting Hate Speech
value.excerpt: Facebook vice president of integrity Guy Rosen tooted the social media company’s own horn for moderating toxic content, writing in a blog post that the prevalence of hate speech on the platform has fallen by nearly half since July 2020.

value.title: Advancing AI Telematics In The Transportation And Logistics Industry Series : Blog #2
value.excerpt: This is the second blog in the AI Transportation and logistics industry. This blog focuses on advancing AI telematics and provides an overview of current state and future state developments. Key questions for CEOs and Board Directors on leading AI are highlighted for digital transformation.

value.title: How AI is helping to make breast cancer history
value.excerpt: With AI helping to diagnose patients earlier and enabling the rapid development of treatments, it is possible that in a few decades, we may no longer have the need for Breast Cancer Awareness Month.

value.title: You Can Now Pay for Ride Fares in the Moscow Subway With Your Face
value.excerpt: As of this week, you can even pay for subway fares with your face. Before you ask where you can sign up, this new facial recognition payment system has debuted in Russia, sparking concerns that it will be used by authorities as a surveillance tool.

value.title: NALSAR, CHSS to empower security agencies with AI course
value.excerpt: Hyderabad: The NALSAR University of Law and the Centre for Human Security Studies (CHSS) have joined hands to organise Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Smart Policing. The 3-day Executive Certificate Program (ECP) to All India Police Departments and Central Paramilitary Forces (CISF-CRPF-SSB-ITBP-BSF) and other important law enforcement agencies in the country.

value.title: Artificial intelligence's data problem meets AI's people problem
value.excerpt: Enterprises are learning that AI implementation 'is not the field of dreams. It is not a build-it-and-they-will-come effort.'

value.title: Scarce chips may pinch Apple's iPhone holiday sales
value.excerpt: According to Refinitiv IBES, analyst are expecting about 45 million units for the fourth quarter and 79.4 million units in the key holiday quarter.

value.title: Can AI Help Prevent Natural Disasters?
value.excerpt: With the power of big data, advanced analytics, and AI geospatial companies can play a critical role in understanding factors contributing to natural disasters like wildfires, the associated risks, and impacts on communities.

value.title: Can Artificial Intelligence Help To Close The Financial Equality Gap For Women?

value.title: Can NYC Build an Ethical Artificial Intelligence Ecosystem?
value.excerpt: As detailed in a 116-page newly released strategy, city officials in New York City are looking to proactively build ethics into machine learning and AI usage as the technologies become vital pieces of everyday life.

value.title: What's so great about Google Tensor? The new Pixel 6 chip, explained
value.excerpt: Google made its own chip to power Pixel 6, but what does that mean for you and for Google? We're coming up on the launch of the Google Pixel 6 and 6 Pro, and, for once, there's a pretty significant change to Google's newest smartphone that isn't just a bigger screen or better camera.

value.title: Facial Recognition Is Finally Raising Questions About Government Accountability

value.title: Sorry former Pentagon expert, but China is nowhere near winning the AI race
value.excerpt: A former Pentagon chief is making the conservative media rounds pushing the China Bogeyman. Sorry, but there's now way China is leading the US in AI.

value.title: Putting artificial intelligence at the heart of health care — with help from MIT
value.excerpt: Cardiologist Demilade Adedinsewo and her Mayo Clinic team are pioneering cutting-edge health care research that uses an artificial intelligence-enhanced method to analyze patient ECGs with help from MIT Professional Education.

value.title: AI project brings the climate crisis to your home
value.excerpt: Thomas covers AI in all its iterations. Likes Werner Herzog films and Arsenal FC. Writer at Neural by TNW — Thomas covers AI in all its iterations. Likes Werner Herzog films and Arsenal FC. Scientists have developed a novel way of making people care about climate change: flooding their homes.

value.title: AI-powered personalization provider Qubit gets acquired by Coveo
value.excerpt: AI-powered relevance platform Coveo acquired Qubit, a leader in AI-powered personalization technology for merchandising teams.

value.title: Qubit the dog on the big questions in quantum computing
value.excerpt: This week we sat down for an interview with Qubit the dog, whose human Julian Kelly is one of our lead Research Scientists with Google Quantum AI. value.title: Spot AI emerges from stealth with $22M with a platform to draw out more intelligence from organizations’ basic security videos
value.excerpt: Security cameras, for better or for worse, are part and parcel of how many businesses monitor spaces in the workplace for security or operational reasons. Now, a startup is coming out of stealth with funding for tech designed to make the video produced by those cameras more useful.

value.title: Finding The Data: How To Avoid AI And Analytics Project Failures
value.excerpt: Overall, I see that success stories in this industry all have one common theme: a well-thought-out data strategy with robust data governance systems.

value.title: Clarifai moves beyond computer vision to manage companies’ unstructured data
value.excerpt: Clarifai enables customers to make sense of the 90% of unstructured data they have using artificial intelligence.

value.title: Embrace The Era Of Change And Evolution With Self-Learning AI

value.title: Five Steps To Successfully Leverage AI In Your Business
